string.description: name of the ClusterMetricExport
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
The field name to add as a attribute
The state DB path to export, in the format '.node.srl.interface'
A regular expression to be applied to the field value.
A regular expression replacement to be applied to the field value.

list_nested.description: List of dynamic attributes to add to the metrics, based on a state DB path.

string.description: Attribute name.
Attribute value.

list_nested.description: List of static attributes to add to the metrics.

single_nested.description: Allows adding static or dynamic attributes to the metrics.

string.description: The name of the field.
The type of the field.

list_nested.description: Optional set of fields to be exposed by this export.

string.description: Period defines the frequency at which the metric is polled.
The new value for the mapped source (must convert to float64).
The value to be mapped (supports regex with capture groups).

list_nested.description: Rules for mapping metric values (e.g., DOWN -> 1, UP -> 2).

string.description: Regular expression for the metric name transformation.
Replacement string for the transformed metric name.

single_nested.description: Regex and replacement for renaming the metric name.

string.description: Mode defines how the metric is collected: periodic, on-change, or periodic-on-change.
The state DB path to export, in the format '.node.srl.interface'

list.description:
List of attributes to include with the metric.
Include all if not set.

string.description: The CR group such as `core.eda.nokia.com`.
The CR kind such as `toponode`.

CR name to be queried.
Get all of not set.
The CR namespace, it defaults to all if not specified.
The CR version such as `v1` or `v1alpha1`.

single_nested.description:
A Custom resource to be used as a source for the metric.
It will generate a metric with the CR attributes and a value of 1.

string.description: Condition for filtering the metric (e.g., 'oper-state = down').

list_nested.description:
List of metrics and their sources to be written to a remote server.
Metrics will be sent using the Prometheus remote write protocol.

list.description: List of remote destination names where metrics will be written.

single_nested.description: ClusterMetricExportSpec defines the desired state of ClusterMetricExport
ClusterMetricExportStatus defines the observed state of ClusterMetricExport

string.description: name of the ClusterReceiver
resource content will be returned as it was at the time of this git hash
Credentials such as a token value
Authorization type

single_nested.description: Authorization token for accessing the server.

string.description: Receiver endpoint.
Export client protocol. Once of `http` or `grpc`.
Path to a certificate authority file.
The client certificate file location.
The client private key location.

bool.description: If true the client will not verify the server's certificate.

single_nested.description: Certificates files.

string.description:
Secret containing a `tls.crt`, a `tls.key` and a `ca.crt` keys.
Both `tls.crt` and `tls.key` must be present.
If `ca.crt` is not present and `.trustBundle` is not set
the remote server certificate is not verified.

ConfigMap containing a set of trust bundles (key `trust-bundle.pem`) used to
verify the remote server certificates.

single_nested.description: TLS configuration for secure connection to the remote server.

int64.description: The buffer size threshold that initiates sending the accumulated metrics to the receiver.

string.description: Compression algorithm. Only gzip supported.

Interval at which metrics stored in the local buffer are sent to the receiver.
Metrics are sent regardless of the buffer size threshold.
Header name
Header value

list_nested.description: Custom HTTP headers to be sent along with each remote write request.

int64.description: Maximum number of metrics per export request.

single_nested.description: Retries options

string.description: Export timeout.

single_nested.description: Remote write options such as: Flush interval, Retries, etc.
ClusterReceiverSpec defines the desired state of ClusterReceiver

string.description: Last encountered error for this receiver
Last checked time for connectivity status

bool.description: Specifies if the receiver is reachable
